Class VillainsLairPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • VillainsLairPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, Refreshable

    public class VillainsLairPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements Refreshable
    Instances of VillainsLairPanel are components of Game objects. They contain all components related to the Villain's Lair in the game, and are displayed when the player enters the Villain's Lair.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Parameters:
        hasWon - A boolean representation of the state of the minigame.

      • refreshBattlePanel

        private void refreshBattlePanel()
        Removes all components from the battle panel and reloads them. Should be called before each round of the battle, to display the correct hero's image, and create a new mini-game.

      • heroImagePanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel heroImagePanel()
        Returns a panel showing the hero's image, name and type, to displayed during and after the battle.
        Returns:
        A panel showing the hero's image, name and type.

      • newMiniGamePanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel newMiniGamePanel()
        Creates and returns a new mini-game panel of one of the three possible types, depending on the games played by the current villain.
        Returns:
        A JPanel containing minigame components.

      • addGameResultPanel

        private void addGameResultPanel()
        Adds a panel to show the result of a mini game.

      • refreshGameResultPanel

        private void refreshGameResultPanel()
        Adds all the required components to show the result of the most recent mini game. Includes whether the hero won or lost, how much damage was done to the hero or villain and how many further rounds need to be won. Alerts the user if the hero has died or if the villain has been defeated.

      • addWonComponents

        private void addWonComponents()
        Adds components to the game result panel showing that the hero won the mini game.

      • addLostComponents

        private void addLostComponents()
        Adds components to the game result panel showing that the hero lost the mini game.
